Luke's big break came when he landed the role of Dylan McKay on the hit TV show "Beverly Hills, 90210" in 1990. The show's success propelled Luke to stardom, and he became a teen heartthrob. In the early 2000s, Luke took a break from acting to focus on his personal life. He married Rachel Minnie Sharp and had two children, Jack and Sophie. During this time, he also became involved in various philanthropic efforts, including working with the American Diabetes Association and the Children's Miracle Network.

The show's success marked a resurgence in Luke's career, and he went on to appear in several more films and TV shows, including "Once Upon a Time in Hollywood" and "Togo".

Luke Perry passed away on March 4, 2019, at the age of 52, leaving behind a legacy as a beloved actor, devoted father, and dedicated philanthropist.
